function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Lack of a comprehensive ontology that models multiple similar diseases may hinder the effective sharing of knowledge and development of vaccines and drugs for emerging pandemics.","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of adoption of biomedical application ontologies","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"category":"Settlement","name":"Inadequate development of new ontologies","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited use of tools and languages for ontology development","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exposure to uv-c radiation from the surfacide system","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"category":"Health","name":"Handling of dried virus and potential exposure to infectious material","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Handling of infectious materials in the built environment","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"category":"Health","name":"Testing mers-cov sensitivity to uv-c under strict containment bsl3 laboratory protocols","confidence":"High"},{"category":"Health","name":"Moist environment created by bleach-soaked pads preventing drying of virus onto glass coverslips","confidence":"High"},{"category":"Health","name":"Plaque counts indicating reduction of viral titers in the laboratory environment","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uv-c exposure time of only 5 minutes resulted in undetectable virus levels for mers-cov and sars-cov.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"category":"Health","name":"Whole-room uv-c system effectiveness against rna viruses like mhv-a59, mers-cov, and sars-cov.","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of the surfacide whole-room uv-c disinfection system during mers outbreaks may prevent nosocomial spread of the virus and protect staff.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exposure to harmful uv-c light due to improper installation or maintenance of uvgi systems","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"category":"Health","name":"Insufficient uv-c irradiation doses to inactivate sars-cov-2 virions in respiratory droplets","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unproven effectiveness of upper-room uvgi in inactivating sars-cov-2 virions in the air","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"category":"Health","name":"The potential for incomplete viral inactivation due to the saturation of the ’target’ with uv photons","confidence":"High"},{"category":"Health","name":"Inaccurate prediction of virus behavior due to unknown z values for specific viral species","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Misinterpretation of uv inactivation plots for some viral species leading to ineffective disinfection strategies","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"category":"Health","name":"The assumption that the room air is well mixed may not hold true in all situations, leading to inaccurate calculations of average particle residence time and irradiation flux.","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inaccurate adjustment of z values for use with upper-room uvgi systems may lead to ineffective disinfection of microbes suspended in the air.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Incorrect computation of average irradiation flux may result in insufficient uvgi exposure to achieve the desired survival fraction of microbes.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unclear disinfection methodology for built environments","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"category":"Health","name":"Variability in published data on uv irradiation of coronaviruses","confidence":"High"},{"category":"Health","name":"Exclusion of studies with high log reductions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty in effective upper-room z value for aerosolised sars-cov-2","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"category":"Health","name":"Estimating the average upper-room irradiation flux for reduction in aerosolised sars-cov-2 virions may lead to incorrect uv-c dosing","confidence":"High"},{"category":"Health","name":"Modeling the performance of a standard upper-room uv fitting when challenged by sars-cov-2 may result in inaccurate assessment of its effectiveness","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited experimental studies on the uv irradiation of aerosolized viruses may result in a lack of understanding of the efficacy of uv treatment on airborne transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Aerosolised viruses appear to be more vulnerable to uv damage than when they are suspended in a liquid or on a substrate.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"category":"Health","name":"Irradiating the coronavirus in liquid requires a uv-c dose that is in the region 1.8-6.0 times higher than that required when the virus is suspended in air.","confidence":"High"},{"category":"Health","name":"The adjustment coefficient c_ur for uv-c dose when the virus is suspended in air may be in a range 0.167-0.545.","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Assumptions made regarding z ur value for upper-room uvgi analysis based on published mean z values for aerosolised coronaviruses","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty associated with assumed z ur value and introduction of worst-case scenario","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Direct inverse relationship between z ur, particle residence time, and required irradiation flux","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"category":"Health","name":"Exposure to uv light may cause harm to human skin and eyes.","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inequality in susceptibility to uv damage among different coronaviruses.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"category":"Health","name":"Variability in uv irradiation experiment methodologies and results.","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Difficulty in inactivating sars-cov-1 and mers-cov compared to influenza a","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Substrate or medium influencing the magnitude of the z value achieved for inactivating microbes","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low penetration depth of uv light through concentrated suspensions","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Paucity of good quality data on uv-c irradiation of sars-cov-1, sars-cov-2, and mers-cov in the air","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"category":"Health","name":"Uncertainty about the validity of using z value for mhv coronavirus as a surrogate for sars-cov-2 in air","confidence":"High"},{"category":"Health","name":"Modeling expected and worst-case scenarios for upper-room uvgi installations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on surrogate z ur values for sars-cov-2","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"category":"Health","name":"Uncertainty about the effects of fragmented uv doses on virus inactivation","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on room air mixing for effective uvgi air disinfection","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor room air mixing and stagnant regions","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"category":"Settlement","name":"Inadequate uv irradiation of larger aerosol particles","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of covid-19 due to poor ventilation and air movement","category":"Air","confidence":"High"}]}
